title: 4-year-old boy hit by stray bullet in parking lot
content:
Please install the latest Adobe Flash Player Plugin to watch this content.
DEKALB COUNTY, Ga. - DeKalb County police are investigating the shooting of a 4-year-old child on the 2000 block of Flat Shoals Road.
The victim's uncle says the victim, 4-year-old Quay, was visiting him at the Highlands of East Atlanta Apartments.
Police say there was an attempted robbery near the apartment complex. The suspects shot more than 20 rounds at the Jeep Wrangler of the would-be victims.
The child was riding his Big Wheel when he was struck by a stray bullet.
Police say that bullet traveled about 150 yards before it hit the victim.
The victim's uncle says he immediately put the boy in his black Jeep Cherokee while he called 911.
The 4-year-old is in critical condition.
Police are questioning robbery victims, and have yet to arrest the robbery suspects.
